Class MFQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • MFQ

  • public class MFQ
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the entire multi-level feedback queue system. Contains all the data for the simulation as well as controlling the flow.
    Author:
    Min-Jae Yi

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getJobs()
      Gets the jobs from the given input file and stores them as objects in a queue.

      Handles creating the window and its default starting values.
      private void outArrivalData(Job job)
      Reports to the console and file when a job arrives with respect to the current MFQ system clock.

      Outputs the header string to the console output and file.
      void outStats()
      Reports all the statistics for the program to the console and file.

      Reports to the console and file when a job departs with respect to the current MFQ system clock.
      void runSimulation()
      Runs the simulation by console.
      void runSimulationGUI()
      Runs the simulation by GUI.
      private void submitQueuedJob()
      Handles submitting a queued job to the MFQ's CPU.

      Handles submitting a queued job to the MFQ's CPU.

      Handles the main algorithm of the program as a single tick.
      private void tickSimulationGUI()
      Handles the main algorithm of the program as a single tick.
      private void totalRecords()
      Totals out records and gets the data ready for the final output string.

      • outArrivalData

        private void outArrivalData(Job job)
        Reports to the console and file when a job arrives with respect to the current MFQ system clock.
        Parameters:
        job - Job that arrived into the system

      • recordOutData

        private void recordOutData(Job job)
        Reports to the console and file when a job departs with respect to the current MFQ system clock.
        Parameters:
        job - Job that left the system
